Description: Ostracon, section (two fragments joining) of the body of a red-brown pottery vessel, worn, the fabric is partially grey in section, the interior is spotted with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a brown slip and remains of three lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394850) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394850)
